critique: This executive order establishes a National Industrial Security Program to safeguard classified information released to contractors, licensees, and grantees. It aims to protect national security and economic/technological interests by creating a single, integrated program. The order outlines policy direction, operational oversight, and implementation details, assigning responsibilities to various agencies and officials. It also establishes an advisory committee and mandates the creation of an operating manual. The order amends a previous executive order and ensures that existing agreements remain in effect until modified. It centralizes authority and oversight in the executive branch to protect classified information. There is no direct impact on immigration, social inclusion, or economic regulation beyond security concerns. The order expands executive power by centralizing control over classified information and establishing a program with broad authority.
